nodes.bodyText: Feel like we can make the argument a Collection or Set, which allows us to use EnumSet.of to specify multiple Status we are looking at.
Thanks for the suggestion. Updated.
How about renaming the method to isFromDeletedContainer?
Updated.
Can we combine this with line 1052-1053?
Updated.
same here

The logic here is to remove blob that belongs to containers being deleted. I would suggest considering edge case where the obsolete container has been removed from Helix account metadata ZNode, however, blobs from that container haven't been cleaned up on certain node (perhaps this node is down for a long time).
Merged the duplicate code. And currently we've decided not to remove obsolete container metadata from Zookeeper. But will keep in mind if we change our decision.
minor: make this private final, then remove line 136
Updated to add final. May I know why I need to remove line 136? The selectedContainers still need to be initialized right?
Thanks. Updated.
should clear selectedcContainers before adding item to it since we are doing for every compaction.
Updated.
why adding a switch case here? In this method we shouldn't really care about the container status, rather than just return all the container with the given status.

It's due to I need to separately handle the INACTIVE and DELETE_IN_PROGRESS status for the future. To support the ACLs during compaction, I need to filter out the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS container which not qualify with the retention time, so only all Inactive containers and qualified Delete_in_progress containers can be remove during that compaction cycle. Does that make sense to you?

it's weird that in line 251 we already specified the status set, but here we have to deal with it again. If this is the case, I encourage you to just ignore status in line 251, by changing this method to something like getAllFilteredContainers.
Updated.
Can you log the selectedContainers as info log before running into compaction?
Updated

Minor comments about comment and naming.

Comment its main functionality first and then describe what does it do.
There is actually not Converts here. It's filter.
getAllFilteredContainers() -> getNotActiveContainers() and comment what is not active: DELETE_IN_PROGRESS and INACTIVE
Updated.
selectedContainers -> notActiveContainers
Updated
how about move this line into getAllFilteredContainers ?
Updated.
Determines if {@code copyCandidate} container in the status of  DELETED_IN_PROGRESS or INACTIVE.
Updated.
nit: we don't need this new variable, you can just add the pair of account id and container id to the notActiveContainers set.
Updated.
selectedContainerPairSet is a class member, do we need to pass it as argument?
Updated.

Sorry, two additional minor questions:

accountService is not initialized in this PR, is it?
I think HelixAccountService may fail to fetch account metadata (i.e.disconnected from ZK), I think the accountService will get containers from local backup file, right?

No, it's in previous PR initialized inside Ambry Server.
Yes, the account metadata will be cached locally, so serving an Account query will not incur any calls to remote Zookeeper.
minor and optional: I feel like deprecatedContainers sounds a better name.
deprecatedContainers  also looks good to me.
